channel.title: BBC News
channel.copyright: Copyright: (C) British Broadcasting Corporation, see https://www.bbc.co.uk/usingthebbc/terms-of-use/#15metadataandrssfeeds for terms and conditions of reuse.

item.title: Father of nine children killed by Israeli strike still in critical condition
item.description: Hamdi al-Najjar's "life remains in danger", a Bulgarian doctor working at Nasser hospital in southern Gaza tells the BBC.

item.title: Israeli strike kills nine of Gaza doctor's children
item.description: A British surgeon working in Nasser Hospital said he had operated on the doctor's surviving 11-year-old.

item.title: Netanyahu accuses Starmer of being on 'wrong side of humanity' and siding with Hamas
item.description: The UK, France and Canada condemned the expanded Israeli military operation in Gaza this week.

item.title: As Israel faces diplomatic 'tsunami', Trump is staying quiet
item.description: This has been a tumultuous week for the Jewish state, the BBC's Paul Adams writes.

item.title: Chaos spreads as desperate Gazans wait for food to arrive
item.description: Lawlessness is stopping food from reaching people, while a clash at an aid convoy on Thursday night turned deadly.

item.title: Suspect charged with murder of two Israeli embassy workers in Washington DC
item.description: The attack is being investigated as a hate crime and could lead to the death penalty, prosecutors say.

item.title: Israeli museum victim 'was planning to propose'
item.description: Yaron Lischinsky bought engagement ring days before he and girlfriend Sarah Milgrim were killed in Washington, ambassador says.

item.title: Investigating Israel's strike on Gaza's European Hospital
item.description: BBC Verify analysed footage, gathered witness testimony and spoke to munitions and legal experts to examine how one of Gaza's last functioning hospitals came under Israeli attack.

item.title: UN says 90 lorry loads of aid now in Gaza after three-day delay at crossing
item.description: The aid, including flour and baby food, was picked up three days after Israel eased an 11-week-long blockade.

item.title: Gazans fear shutdown of water plants as Israel widens offensive
item.description: Parents say children are having to drink unsafe and salty water, as fuel shortages threaten desalination and hygiene facilities.

item.title: Gaza health system 'stretched beyond breaking point' by Israeli offensive, WHO warns
item.description: The UN agency says Israeli ground operations and evacuation orders are putting hospitals out of service or making them inaccessible.

item.title: Anti-Hamas protests in southern Gaza enter third day
item.description: Protesters were seen in videos calling for an end to the war and the removal of the armed group from Gaza

item.title: Israel fires 'warning shots' near diplomats in West Bank
item.description: Many nations have condemned the Israel military, which says a delegation visiting Jenin deviated from an agreed route.

item.title: US accepts Qatari plane into Air Force One fleet
item.description: The White House insists that the gift is legal, but some of Trump's biggest backers have criticised the deal.

item.title: Gaza baby sent back to war zone after open-heart surgery in Jordan
item.description: Baby Niveen was evacuated to Jordan for medical treatment, but has now been sent back to Gaza.

item.title: Gaza aid yet to reach civilians, UN says, as pressure grows on Israel
item.description: Israel agreed on Sunday to allow a "basic amount of food" to enter Gaza, where global experts have warned of a looming famine.

item.title: Israel fires 'warning shots' near diplomats in West Bank
item.description: Many nations have condemned the Israel military, which says a delegation visiting Jenin deviated from an agreed route.

item.title: UK sanctions 'godmother' of Israel's settler movement Daniella Weiss
item.description: The foreign secretary said the move "demonstrates our determination to hold extremist settlers to account".

item.title: UK, France and Canada threaten action against Israel over Gaza
item.description: The UK, France and Canada "strongly oppose" Benjamin Netanyahu's expansion of military operations, a statement from their leaders said.

item.title: Iran's Khamenei doubts US nuclear talks will lead to agreement
item.description: "We don't think it will lead to any outcome," the supreme leader warns, saying the US is making "outrageous" demands on uranium enrichment.

item.title: What we know about Israeli embassy staff shooting
item.description: Police say the victims, a young couple, were shot by a man who shouted "free, free Palestine".

item.title: Paul Adams: Starmer and Lammy sound genuinely angry at Israel
item.description: The PM sounded genuinely angry at Israel's aid blockade and expanded Gaza offensive, writes diplomatic correspondent Paul Adams.

item.title: Jeremy Bowen: Goodwill running out as UK, France and Canada demand Israel end Gaza offensive
item.description: France, the UK and Canada are among nations that have sharpened their criticism of Israel's ground offensive.

item.title: Did Trump really strike Gulf deals worth $2tn?
item.description: Some analysts question whether the amount of investment will ultimately be that high.

item.title: Trump's frantic week of peace brokering hints at what he really wants
item.description: After seven breathless days of diplomatic hurly burly, we have a clearer idea of the US president's global ideology - and the limits of his 'art of a deal'.

item.title: 'My children go to sleep hungry,' Gazans tell the BBC
item.description: The BBC speaks to people in Gaza during a 10-week blockade on food, medical supplies and other aid.

item.title: BBC joins Gaza children as they are evacuated to Jordan for treatment
item.description: The BBC's Fergal Keane accompanies children being evacuated from Gaza on their journey to Jordan.

item.title: Iran using criminal gangs for hit jobs abroad, court papers show
item.description: Organised gangs are paid to carry out attacks and kidnappings, evidence uncovered by the BBC reveals.

item.title: 'I'm overjoyed to be back': Syrians face daunting rebuild after years of war
item.description: The BBC joins a convoy bringing families back to Homs, which saw some of the fiercest fighting.

item.title: Scared and malnourished - footage from Gaza shows plight of children and aftermath of Israeli strike
item.description: Israel says it targeted top Hamas militants hiding among civilians at the Khan Younis hospital.

item.title: Trump's meeting with Sharaa, unthinkable just months ago, boosts Syrians' hopes
item.description: Syria's interim leader met the US president in Riyadh after he announced he would lift sanctions on Syria.

item.title: 'I've practised being booed', Israel's Eurovision entry who survived Hamas attack tells BBC
item.description: Yuval Raphael, who survived the 7 October attack, says performing her ballad New Day Will Rise is a "personal win".

item.title: ‘Children handcuffed and shot’ – ex-UK Special Forces break silence on ‘war crimes’ by colleagues
item.description: Veterans who served with the SAS and SBS give BBC Panorama eyewitness accounts of alleged executions.

item.title: BBC team's tense encounter with sanctioned Israeli settler while filming in West Bank
item.description: Israeli settler Moshe Sharvit established a so-called 'outpost' in occupied West Bank

item.title: BBC sees Gaza aid going through inspection area at Israeli crossing
item.description: The BBC's Wyre Davies visits the Kerem Shalom crossing, through which aid for Gaza is currently passing after Israel eased an 11-week blockade.

item.title: Witnesses who saw shooter inside Jewish museum speak to BBC
item.description: Witnesses tell the BBC about hearing gunshots and the shooter shouting: 'Free Palestine'.

item.title: British surgeon's 'high anxiety' operating in Gaza
item.description: Dr Rose has been describing life at Nassar Hospital in Gazan city of Khan Younis.

item.title: BBC Verify examines Israeli strikes as minimal aid enters Gaza
item.description: Israel says its reopened access for a limited number of aid trucks into Gaza, after blocking supplies from entering the territory for the last 11 weeks. BBC Verify has been looking into the latest strikes and aid situation in Gaza.

item.title: Gazan babies will die without aid - UN humanitarian chief
item.description: About 14,000 babies will die in 48 hours if aid does not reach them, a UN humanitarian chief warns.

item.title: Ros Atkins on... Trump's deals in the Gulf
item.description: The BBC's Analysis Editor Ros Atkins examines President Trump's trip to the Gulf.

item.title: Watch: UK surgeon shares footage from Gaza hospital after deadly Israeli strike
item.description: Tuesday's strike killed 28 people, the Hamas-run civil defence said. Israel says it was a precise strike on Hamas.

item.title: Israeli 'bunker buster' bombs used in Gaza hospital strike, experts say
item.description: CCTV footage obtained and verified by the BBC shows the moment before impact and the immediate aftermath. Munitions experts told BBC Verify that the strikes and destruction are consistent with the use of so-called "bunker buster" bombs - designed to hit underground targets. BBC Verify's Merlyn Thomas has more.
